sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The tragicall and true historie which happened betwene two English louers. 1563 written by Ber. Gar. 1565. B. G. (Bernard Garter) Brooke, Arthur, d. 1563. Romeus and Juliet.
[4], 59 leaves
in Fletestrete within Temple Barre, at the signe of the hande and Starre] In ædibus Richardi Totelli. Cum priuilegio, [Imprnted [sic] at London : [anno. 1565]
"To the reader" signed: Ber. Gar., i.e. Bernard Garter. Place and date of publication from colophon. An imitation, in verse, of: Brooke, Arthur. Romeus and Juliet. Running title reads: The tragicall history of two english louers. Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library, Washington, D.C.
=======

"To the reader" signed: Ber. Gar., i.e. Bernard Garter. Place and date of publication from colophon. An imitation, in verse, of: Brooke, Arthur. Romeus and Juliet. Running title reads: The tragicall history of two english louers. Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library, Washington, D.C.
